TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit NumberingSystem extends Java.Lang.Object

Docs.summary: NumberingSystem is the base class for all number systems.

remarks.para: NumberingSystem is the base class for all number systems. This class provides the interface for setting different numbering system types, whether it be a simple alternate digit system such as Thai digits or Devanagari digits, or an algorithmic numbering system such as Hebrew numbering or Chinese numbering.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

remarks.para: Default constructor. Returns a numbering system that uses the Latin-script decimal digits 0 through 9. This should be equivalent to NumberingSystem.LATIN.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(native int javaReference, valuetype Android.Runtime.JniHandleOwnership transfer) cil managed

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Returns the description string of the current numbering system.

remarks.para: Returns the description string of the current numbering system. The description string describes the characteristics of the numbering system. For numeric systems, this string contains the digits used by the numbering system, in order, starting from zero. For algorithmic numbering systems, the string contains the name of the RBNF ruleset in the locale's NumberingSystemRules section that will be used to format numbers using this numbering system.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Returns a string array containing a list of the names of numbering systems currently known to ICU.
Docs.returns: An array of strings in alphabetical (invariant) order.

remarks.para: Returns a string array containing a list of the names of numbering systems currently known to ICU.

MemberSignature.Value: public static Android.Icu.Text.NumberingSystem? GetInstance (int radix_in, bool isAlgorithmic_in, string? desc_in);
.method public static hidebysig class Android.Icu.Text.NumberingSystem GetInstance(int32 radix_in, bool isAlgorithmic_in, string desc_in) cil managed
static member GetInstance : int * bool * string -> Android.Icu.Text.NumberingSystem

Docs.param: The radix for this numbering system. ICU currently supports only numbering systems whose radix is 10.
Specifies whether the numbering system is algorithmic (true) or numeric (false).

String used to describe the characteristics of the numbering system. For numeric systems, this string contains the digits used by the numbering system, in order, starting from zero. For algorithmic numbering systems, the string contains the name of the RBNF ruleset in the locale's NumberingSystemRules section that will be used to format numbers using this numbering system.
Docs.summary: Factory method for creating a numbering system.

remarks.para: Factory method for creating a numbering system.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig class Android.Icu.Text.NumberingSystem GetInstanceByName(string name) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the desired numbering system. Numbering system names often correspond with the name of the script they are associated with. For example, "thai" for Thai digits, "hebr" for Hebrew numerals.
Docs.summary: Returns a numbering system from one of the predefined numbering systems known to ICU.
Docs.returns: The NumberingSystem instance, or null if not available.

remarks.para: Returns a numbering system from one of the predefined numbering systems known to ICU. Numbering system names are based on the numbering systems defined in CLDR. To get a list of available numbering systems, use the getAvailableNames method.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Returns the default numbering system for the default FORMAT locale.

remarks.para: Returns the default numbering system for the default FORMAT locale.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Returns the numbering system's algorithmic status.

remarks.para: Returns the numbering system's algorithmic status. If true, the numbering system is algorithmic and uses an RBNF formatter to format numerals. If false, the numbering system is numeric and uses a fixed set of digits.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig bool IsValidDigitString(string str) cil managed

Docs.summary: Convenience method to determine if a given digit string is valid for use as a descriptor of a numeric ( non-algorithmic ) numbering system.

remarks.para: Convenience method to determine if a given digit string is valid for use as a descriptor of a numeric ( non-algorithmic ) numbering system. In order for a digit string to be valid, it must contain exactly ten Unicode code points.
